summary: Felipe N. Martins (Dr.) currently holds a position of Senior Lecturer-Researcher at Hanze University of Applied Sciences (the Netherlands), where he is a member of the research group Sensors and Smart Systems. He is involved in courses and projects related to robotics and electronics, both in bachelor and master levels. His background is in Electrical Engineering, with a focus on control of mobile robots. During his PhD he worked on modeling, simulation and adaptive nonlinear control of mobile robots, including multi-robot coordination. During his master's, he implemented a controller for a brushless DC motor and developed a fuzzy controller for a three-phase induction motor to operate as a generator. Before joining academia, Felipe worked as an engineer for 4 years with design and maintenance of industrial automation machines. Felipe also has over 10 years of experience in applying and developing educational robotics, including robotics competitions like the RoboCup Junior.

projects.title: Robot Soccer Simulator (ROSOS)
projects.description: RoSoS is an Open-source platform written in Java/Processing that gives control to Autonomous Robots simulated on the computer. People can code their own robots and make them play against other teams. Every piece of code was written in Java, including it's own particle collision handler, Robot API and Game controllers.

projects.title: Robotics Simulation Labs
projects.description: The simulation labs were created to replace the lab activities from my Robotics course due to the Corona-related restrictions of 2020/2021. This is an introductory level course on Robotics for engineering students, focusing on wheeled mobile robots.

profile_positions.description: Senior Lecturer of Robotics and Electronics at the Institute of Engineering. Researcher at the Sensors and Smart Systems research group. Supervisor of bachelor and master students working on graduation and research projects.
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer and Researcher

profile_positions.company: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen
profile_positions.description: Lecturer of Robotics and Electronics at the Institute of Engineering. Researcher at the Sensors and Smart Systems research group. Supervisor of bachelor and master students working on graduation and research projects.

company.name: Ifes - Instituto Federal do Espírito Santo

profile_positions.company: Ifes - Instituto Federal do Espírito Santo
profile_positions.description: Lecturer at the Control and Automation Engineering program and Technical course on Industrial Automation, teaching Robotics, Electronics and Electricity. Supervised students working on scientific initiation and on robotics projects, some of which received awards in national and international robotics competitions. Founding member and leader of NERA, a research group on robotics and automation. Was a member of several committees, including the Board of Education, Research, Graduation and Extension of IFES, the IFES Graduation Committee, the Serra Campus Strategic Planning Committee, and many others.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.company: Ifes - Instituto Federal do Espírito Santo
profile_positions.description: Director of Education of Serra Campus, which had about 1500 students in 6 programs: two technical programs (post high-school level), three bachelor programs and one specialization program (post-BSc level).
profile_positions.title: Director of Education

company.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

profile_positions.location: Institute of Engineering, Assen, The Netherlands
profile_positions.company: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen
profile_positions.description:
Lecturer of Electronics for the Advanced Sensors Applications (ASA) program at the Institute of Engineering in Assen. Supervised undergraduate students working on research projects, including final graduation projects. Member of ASA Curriculum Committee. 
This activity was part of a cooperation agreement between Hanze and IFES for exchange of students, lecturers and researchers.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Lecturer

profile_positions.location: Artificial Intelligence and Cognitive Engineering (ALICE),Groningen, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
With Scholarship from CAPES, a Foundation within the Ministry of Education in Brazil. 
Worked with computer vision applied to aerial robotics, supervised by Dr. Marco Wiering. Was second supervisor of a master's student and two undergraduate students' final projects.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Researcher (Post-doc)

profile_positions.description: Lecturer of Control Systems, Sensors and Microcontrollers. Supervised several undergraduate and specialization students working on their final graduation projects and scientific initiation, five of which received the ISA-ES Education Award. Honored by five classes of Engineering graduates.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description: Coordinator for the specialization program on Mechatronics Engineering (post-BSc level)
profile_positions.title: Program Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Visiting researcher at the Institute of Automatica, UNSJ, while doing PhD. Worked there for 3 non-consecutive semesters in 2006, 2007 and 2008. Co-supervised by Prof. Ricardo Carelli.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Researcher (PhD student)

profile_positions.description: Worked with design of printed circuit boards (PCBs) and electrical systems for machines, test of electronic circuits, machine maintenance and writing of user manuals. Coordinated the team working at the laboratory of electronics.
profile_positions.title: Electrical Engineer

profile_positions.description: Visiting researcher during Master's internship. Worked with DSP programming to control a brushless DC motor for a sailing boat. This was part of a project to design and build an electrical propulsion system for a solar-powered boat. The project was executed by NHL University and Hoora Watersports company.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Researcher (Master’s student)

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Technical Committee - RoboCup Junior Soccer
volunteer_experiences.description: RoboCupJunior is a project-oriented educational initiative that sponsors local, regional and international robotic events for young students. It is part of RoboCup, which orginizes multiple tournaments in different countries all over the world. RoboCup was founded in 1997 with the main goal of “developing by 2050 a Robot Soccer team capable of winning against the human team champion of the FIFA World Cup”.

company.name: Latin American Robotics Competition (LARS) and Brazilian Robotics Competition (CBR)
Olimpíada Brasileira de Robótica (Brazilian Robotics Olympiad)

volunteer_experiences.description: The Robotics Olympiad (OBR) is a Brazilian scientific competition supported by National Council for Scientific and Technological Development (CNPq) that uses the theme of robotics to encourage young students to take scientific and technological careers, to identify talented young people and to promote discussions and updates in the Brazilian teaching-learning process.

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Technical Committee - ISA-Show ES
volunteer_experiences.description: ISA - Espirito Santo Section - organizes an annual event that consists of a Automation Fair and a Technical Seminar. The Technical Committee is responsible for evaluating the technical quality of the works that are submitted for presentation during the seminar.
